Class HeapSort

  • java.lang.Object
    • HeapSort
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable

    public class HeapSort
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Runnable
    Written by Brian Wing. A wrapper for implementing a Heapsorting algorithm.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      HeapSort(SortingAlgorithms sa)
      Instantiates HeapSort with runtime and iteration counts set to zero.
      HeapSort(SortingAlgorithms sa, int[] array)
      Instantiates HeapSort with runtime and iteration counts set to zero and the array to be sorted as given.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int getCount()
      Returns the number of times elements were swapped for the last sort.
      long getRuntime()
      Returns the last sort run time in nanoseconds.
      long getRuntimeMS()
      Returns the last sort run time in milliseconds.
      void run()
      Sort the given array in a new Thread and report back with the results.
      int[] sort()
      Perform heapsort on array.
      java.lang.String toString()
      Returns a delimited String with commas separating each array element.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • HeapSort

        public HeapSort(SortingAlgorithms sa)
        Instantiates HeapSort with runtime and iteration counts set to zero.
        Parameters:
        sa - The SortingAlgorithms that called this constructor.

      • HeapSort

        public HeapSort(SortingAlgorithms sa,
                int[] array)
        Instantiates HeapSort with runtime and iteration counts set to zero and the array to be sorted as given. The given array is copied so as to allow for sorting without changing the original array.
        Parameters:
        sa - The SortingAlgorithms that called this constructor.
        array - The array to sort.

        Returns the number of times elements were swapped for the last sort.
